original_HC_definition: Specified by data entry person.  Title of paper in most cases.
label: Dataset Name
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.
examples: Grinnell Resurvey Mammals, Lacey Ctenomys Recaptures

original_HC_definition: A unique identifer automatically filled out for the record when ingested to MOL
label: Dataset ID
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

original_HC_definition: The entity making the dataset available
The legal description giving official permission to do something with the dataset
label: License
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

original_HC_definition: The entity that holds the rights to the dataset
label: Rights Holders
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.
examples: The Regents of the University of California

original_HC_definition: The date when the dataset was changed
label: Modified
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The most recent date-time on which the resource was changed.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
examples: 1963-03-08T14:07-0600 (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC). 2009-02-20T08:40Z (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC). 2018-08-29T15:19 (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018). 1809-02-12 (some time during 12 February 1809). 1906-06 (some time in June 1906). 1971 (some time in the year 1971). 2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z (some time during the interval between 1 March 2007 1pm UTC and 11 May 2008 3:30pm UTC). 1900/1909 (some time during the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and the end of the year 1909). 2007-11-13/15 (some time in the interval between 13 November 2007 and 15 November 2007).

original_HC_definition: The person or people who performed the inventory
label: Sampling Performed By
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A person, group, or organization responsible for recording the sampling event(s) contributing to the one referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
The sampling event could be of any hierarchy, including individual inventories and summary inventories.
In the case of a summary inventory include all the organizations or people involved in the individual sampling events that contributed to the compilation. Recommended best practice is to separate the values from different inventories in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: Individual sampling examples: 'North American Butterlfy Association', 'KK Wall'. Summary inventory example: 'JJ Green, LL Pink and FF Grey | Aspen Center for Environmental Studies'

original_HC_definition: The APA formatted reference to the published description of the checklist
notes: Request to add event example in DwC: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/311
label: Bibliographic Citation
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A bibliographic reference for the resource as a statement indicating how this record should be cited (attributed) when used.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.
examples: Specimen example: Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, UC Berkeley. MVZ Mammal Collection (Arctos). Record ID: http://arctos.database.museum/guid/MVZ:Mamm:165861?seid=101356. Source: http://ipt.vertnet.org:8080/ipt/resource.do?r=mvz_mammal. Taxon example: Oliver P. Pearson. 1985. Los tuco-tucos (genera Ctenomys) de los Parques Nacionales Lanin y Nahuel Huapi, Argentina Historia Natural, 5(37):337-343..

original_HC_definition: A reference identifer.  DOI is preferred but a URI or ISBN number is adequate
A full URL to the cited document, if available
Names of the data entry recorders and validators for this dataset
notes: EML route would be: eml:dataset/associatedParty and eml:dataset/associatedParty/role. See https://eml.ecoinformatics.org/schema/eml-resource_xsd.html#ResourceGroup_associatedParty. See https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/14

original_HC_definition: Names of those reviewing entries during a QA/QC process
notes: EML route would be: eml:dataset/associatedParty and eml:dataset/associatedParty/role. See https://eml.ecoinformatics.org/schema/eml-resource_xsd.html#ResourceGroup_associatedParty. See https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/14

original_HC_definition: The agent(s) who performed taxonomic identifications in the field
label: Identified By
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: James L. Patton, Theodore Pappenfuss | Robert Macey

original_HC_definition: How confident is the assessor in the quality of identifications on a scale from 1 (not confident) to 5 (fully confident)

original_HC_label: citation reference of taxonomic authority for identification
original_HC_definition: The published reference to the taxonomic authority used in the checklist
label: Identification References
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004., Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.

original_HC_definition: Author-reported number of separate sites inventoried
notes: Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Total number of individual sites inventoried during sampling event(s) contributing to the one referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: [COMPLETE THIS when we get the definition of "site"]

original_HC_definition: Author-reported hierarchical sample design e.g. sampled subunits nested with larger units
notes: Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Textual description of the  hierarchical sampling design.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: [COMPLETE THIS when we get the definition of "site"]
examples: 5 individual sampling sites of 3-5 plots each'

original_HC_definition: Author-reported site names
notes: Proposed term name change. Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of original site names.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). [COMPLETE THIS when we get the definition of "site"]
examples: 'East Coastal Fringe | St. Marks Wildlife Management Area', 'S1 | S2 | C1 | C2 | R14 | R22 | W1'

original_HC_definition: Author-reported site information (utilizes terms below per site if more than one)
notes: Proposed term name change. Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Original textual description of survey site(s).
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). [COMPLETE THIS when we get the definition of "site"]
examples: 'Wet flatwoods | Wet depression surrounded by mesic longleaf pine flatwoods | Ground cover of thick Andropogon spp., Sporobolus floridanus, Vaccinium spp, Rhynchospora spp., Centella erecta, Panicum rigidulum.', 'S=scrub | G=grassland | P=pasture | I=dunes | P=Bishop Pine Forest | R=Riparian | W=Redwood Forest'

original_HC_definition: The region of the inventory as described in text form (e.g. "Kruger National Park" or "Alberta")
notes:
Mapping to several DwC terms in Location class, all in the Event Core. Request to DwC to add protected area example in dwc:locality
https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/315. See https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/15

original_HC_label: total area covered by geospatial scope
original_HC_definition: Author's reported total area of the geospatial scope in km2

original_HC_label: total area covered by species inventory
original_HC_definition: Author's reported total area covered by effort to inventory species in km2 (always less than or equal to "geospatial scope" term above
Author's reported latitude or latitude range reported for the geospatial scope
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (verbatimLatitude, decimalLatitude, verbatimCoordinates)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported latitude or longitude range reported for the geospatial scope
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (verbatimLongitude, decimalLongitude, verbatimCoordinates)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported elevational lower bound
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term  (minimumElevationInMeters, verbatimElevation)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported elevation upper bound
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term  (maximumElevationInMeters, verbatimElevation)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported unit of elevation (e.g. meters, feet)
Author's reported depth lower bound
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (verbatimDepth, minimumDepthInMeters)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported depth upper bound
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (verbatimDepth, maximumDepthInMeters)

original_HC_definition: Author's reported unit of depth (e.g. meters, feet)
The time blocks in which surveys were performed, either in sum or by site.

original_HC_label: number of time units spent surveying in each block
original_HC_definition: The number of (months, days, hours) spent in each time block.
The temporal units described for the time block (months, days, years)
The year surveying began
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, year)

original_HC_definition: The month surveying began
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, month)

original_HC_definition: The day surveying began
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, day)

original_HC_definition: The year surveying ended
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, year)

original_HC_definition: The month surveying ended
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, month)

original_HC_definition: The day surveying ended
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, verbatimEventDate, day)

original_HC_definition: The hour of day started
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, eventTime)

original_HC_definition: The hour of day ended
notes: Could actually be mapped to more than one DwC term (eventDate, eventTime)

original_HC_definition: Author reported sampling during day, night, or both?
label: Diurnality
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Part of the day relative to the sunlight condition during which the event occurred.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Did the author report seasons surveyed?  Which ones (from a pick list).
label: Season
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Season during which the event occurred.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Set of searched species during inventory
label: Taxonomic Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Taxonomic groups included in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
The sampling event could be of any hierarchy, including individual inventories and summary inventories.
In the case of a summary inventory, include all taxonomic groups surveyed in the individual sampling events that contributed to the compilation. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Set of species explicitly excluded from the inventory
label: Excluded Taxonomic Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Taxonomic groups explicitely excluded in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
The sampling event could be of any hierarchy, including individual inventories and summary inventories.
In the case of a summary inventory include all the taxonomic groups explicitely excluded from the individual sampling events that contributed to the compilation. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Type(s) of individuals included  when sampling due to developmental stage.  Pick list: "Adult/Reproductive/Juvenile/Larval/Seedling/Vegetative/Reproductive"
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Life Stage Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) included in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record at the time it was recorded.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Type(s) of individuals excluded when sampling due to developmental stage. Pick list: "Adult/Reproductive/Juvenile/Larval/Seedling/Vegetative/Reproductive"
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Excluded Life Stage Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) explicitly excluded in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record at the time it was recorded.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Distributional status explicitly included in inventory. Pick list: "Native/Non-Native/Invasive/Naturalized"
label: Degree Of Establishment Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Degree(s) of establishment included in the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/degreeOfEstablishment). Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. If many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Distributional status explicitly exluded in inventory. Pick list: "Native/Non-Native/Invasive/Naturalized"
label: Excluded Degree Of Establishment Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Degree(s) of establishment explicitly excluded from the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/degreeOfEstablishment). Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. If many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Growth form explicitly included in inventory. Current controlled vocab. list: tree/shrub.
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Growth Form Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Growth form or habit of the biological individual(s) included in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Growth form explicitly excluded in inventory.   Current controlled vocab. list: tree/shrub.
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Excluded Growth Form Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Growth form or habit of the biological individual(s) explicitly excluded from the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Size classes included in the study for the prospective taxa (e.g., only small mammals)
Size classes excluded in the study for the prospective taxa (e.g., only small mammals)
Controlled vocabulary includes "Environment reported by site", "reported but not by site", and "not reported"
A verbatim text description of the habitats reported as included in the surveys
label: Habitat Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The original textual description of the habitats included in the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.
examples: 'scrub', 'grassland', 'dunes', 'pine forest', 'riparian', 'Redwood burnt 5 years ago', 'wetlands mostly covered by sedges and sparse woody vegetation'

original_HC_definition: A verbatim text description of the habitats explicitly reported as not included in the surveys
label: Excluded Habitat Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The original textual description of the habitats explicitly excluded from the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record.

original_HC_label: reported on the ground weather conditions
original_HC_definition: Weather or climate conditions experienced during the survey (e.g., drought, frost)
label: Reported Weather
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list of weather or climatic conditions present at the time of the sampling event(s) referred to in the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.

original_HC_definition: Adverse conditions that affected the survey or survey sites (e.g., fire, floods)
label: Reported Extreme Conditions
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of any extreme weather event(s) or environmental condition(s) that may have affected the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.
examples: flooding during week 3 of surveys', 'rockslide at site 2'

original_HC_definition: Compiled data is ancillary data that was not directly collected by authors but assembled from other sources. Inventories can be compiled only, survey only, or both.
label: Compilation Type
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement specifying whether inventory data reported are derived from sampling event(s), anicillary data compiled from other sources, or a combination of both.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is only relevant if the event referred to in the record is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

original_HC_definition: Compilation types include expert and local knowledge, museum specimens, literature, or other sources
label: Compilation Source Types
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Types of data sources contributing to the compilation reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is only relevant if the event referred to in the records is a compilation in which one or more types of data sources may have been used to build the summary. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Inventory type can be restricted search, open search,  opportunistic search, trap, incidental or adventitous or material sample. Recommend using a subclasee of bco:taxonomic inventory process.
label: Inventory Type
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The type(s) of search process(es) used to conduct the inventory.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
This term is only relevant if the event referred to in the record is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the terms included under the Biological Collections Ontology superclass 'taxonomic inventory process' (http://
purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BCO_0000047). If multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: shape of search area  (if restricted or open search)
original_HC_definition: The shape of the search area can be rectangle, circle, line, or polygon
label: Inventory Geometry Type
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The type(s) of geometric shape of the survey area(s).
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: The published name of the protocol used to carry out survey (e.g., Pollard walk)
notes: Suggestion made to DwC to tweak definition slightly (to include plurals) and to add comment. See: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/322
label: Sampling Protocol
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.
examples: UV light trap, mist net, bottom trawl, ad hoc observation, point count, Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x, Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp., http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf

original_HC_definition: Any variations in the published protocol.  For compilations that don't have a standard protocol or have an unpublished protocol, details are presented here.
APA (American Psychological Association) formatted reference to protocol used
DOI, URL or ISBN to the published protocol reference if available
Did the survey results include number of individuals captured per species? (yes/no)
label: Is Abundance Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether the number of individuals collected or observed per species is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the event referred to in the record is a summary inventory that contains at least one reported abundance, the value should be 'true'. Typically abundance values reported would be associated with related occurrences, either under the term dwc:individualCount or the combination of terms dwc:organismQuantity and dwc:organismQuantityType.

original_HC_definition: What value, if any, was used a maximum cap on reported abundances? (yes/no)
label: Is Abundance Cap Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether by design a maximum number of individuals of a given species is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the event referred to in the record is a summary inventory that contains at least one reported abundance capped, the value should be 'true'. Typically values of abundance cap would be captured under the term dwc:samplingProtocol.

original_HC_definition: In vegetation surveys, was cover metric reported as output (yes/no)
label: Is Vegetation Cover Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether a vegetation cover metric is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Typically values or description of vegetation cover would be captured under the term hc:verbatimSiteDescription.

original_HC_definition: Did the authors report species expected in the survey that were not found? (yes/no)
label: Is Absence Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether taxonomic absences are reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Absences could be reported at any taxonomic level.

original_HC_definition: List of taxa reported absence(s) at whatever taxonomic level reported
label: Absent Taxa
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported absent during the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Absences could be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: 'Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus', 'Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta'

original_HC_label: were specimen vouchers taken during survey?
original_HC_definition: Did the authors collect specimen vouchers? (yes/no)
label: Has Vouchers
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether specimen vouchers were collected during the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.

original_HC_definition: If collected, the name of the repository where vouchers were deposited
label: Voucher Institution
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of the name(s) (or acronyms) in use by the institution(s) where vouchers collected during the sampling event(s) were deposited.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: were samples taken from organisms during survey?
original_HC_definition: Did the author collect samples from organisms during the survey?
label: Has Material Samples
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether material samples were taken during the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is based on the definition of the Darwin Core Class MaterialSample (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/MaterialSample).

original_HC_label: what kind of samples were taken from organisms?
original_HC_definition: Sample types include blood, tissue, fecal, etc.
label: Material Sample Types
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of material sample types collected during the sampling event(s) referred to in the record.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is based on the definition of the Darwin Core Class MaterialSample (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/MaterialSample). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if multiple values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: were measurements of organisms taken during survey?
original_HC_definition: This explicitly refers to physical measurements e.g. length, mass, etc. (yes/no)
label: Has Traits
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether trait data of the organisms associated with the sampling event(s) are recorded.

original_HC_definition: The agent taking the recording.  This can be "human" or "machine" (e.g., camera traps)
Measured as "low, medium and high" and discussed in more detail in paper text.
notes:
See sections in HC paper:
- Reporting on methodology and effort
- Determining overall compilation and survey effort.

original_HC_definition: Measured as "no/partial/complete".
label: Is Effort Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether effort associated with the sampling event(s) is reported.

original_HC_label: if partial, for which part did authors provide info?
original_HC_definition: For cases where effort was made clear for only some parts of the surveying effort
Maximum amount of effort based on author reporting or data-entry person
label: Sampling Effort
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The amount of effort expended during an Event.
examples: "40 trap-nights", "10 observer-hours; 10 km by foot; 30 km by car"

original_HC_definition: The units of efforts (bucket-night, net-hours, person-hours, sample-days, trap-nights, or other)
Minimum anount of effort based on author reporting or data-entry person
The units of efforts (bucket-night, net-hours, person-hours, sample-days, trap-nights, or other)

original_HC_label: more granular breakdown of effort reported?
original_HC_definition: Choose "yes" if effort was broken down by day/night, individual site, or other criteria, otherwise "no"
A verbal description of how effort was reported in more detail, e.g. by individual sites or sampling time blocks

original_HC_label: effort calculated by author or by data entry person?
original_HC_definition: Was the final assessment of effort reported directly by author or an assessment by data entry person?
If calculated, what data and what method were used to determine assessment of effort?
label: Effort Calculation Protocol
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or rationale used to determine the sampling effort.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: The sampling effort may be originally reported or inferred.
examples: 'summed from reporting of hours', 'summed time trawled'

original_HC_definition: A list of any data quality procedures that were reported by the inventory authors.
notes: EML route would be: eml:dataset/methods/qualityControl. See https://eml.ecoinformatics.org/schema/eml-dataset_xsd.html. See https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/14

original_HC_definition: Choices for this field:  "No, not reported", "Yes, reported as complete", "Yes, reported as incomplete".
label: Taxon Completeness Originally Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Statement about whether the taxonomic completeness of the sampling event(s) contributing to the event referred to in the record was orginally reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and, if many values applicable, separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: if reported incomplete, was how incompleteness assessed?
original_HC_definition: If author reported their assessment of incompleteness, capture author reported measurement or inferred assessment of incompleteness.
label: Original Taxon Completeness Method
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or rationale originally used to assess reported taxonomic completeness.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the method was not originally reported but inferred afterwards use the term inferredTaxonCompletenessMethod. If many descriptions applicable, separate them with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: A description of the rationale for the inferred completeness assessment often based on how well sampling was done across the geospatial scope, and the survey and compilation effort.
label: Inferred Taxon Completeness Method
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or rationale used to infer taxonomic completeness, if not originally reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
Often based on sampling thoroughness relative to the geospatial scope, and the survey and compilation effort. If the method was originally reported use the term taxonCompletenessMethod.
If many descriptions applicable, separate them with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: 'Complete census likely to yield full assessment of species in area.', 'Assessed based on effort and geospatial scope.   Assumed that 26 hours was sufficient to cover 24km2 in some but not full detail.'

original_HC_label: inferred or reported taxonomic completeness , lower bound
original_HC_definition: Inferred lower bound completeness is captured in quartiles (0, 25, 50,  75, 100).
label: Minimum Taxon Completeness In Quartiles
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Lower reported or inferred taxonomic completeness limit in quartiles.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: In the case of events that are a compilation of multiple events, such as a summary inventory, completeness should refer to the highest level event of the compilation.

original_HC_label: inferred or reported taxonomic completeness, upper bound
original_HC_definition: Inferred upper bound completeness is captured in quartlies (0, 25, 50, 75, 100).
label: Maximum Taxon Completeness In Quartiles
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Upper reported or inferred taxonomic completeness limit in quartiles.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: In the case of events that are a compilation of multiple events, such as a summary inventory, completeness should refer to the highest level event of the compilation.
